page.title: 02THE MAIN SETTLEMENT
page.content: The main feature of interest in the area is{Loppington Village,}which has (in 1985) just been designated a {conservation area}because of its quaint character. The village centres around the church, which dates from Norman times. The settlement plan is {mediaeval}in origin and there are many fine examples of 15th and 16th century timber frame cottages including a{ {cruck cottage.}There are also later buildings in brick, some with fine architectural detailing. There are a number of contemporary houses, including a new scheme of thirteen starter homes now being built and due for completion early in 1986. Loppington boasts the only remaining{ {bull baiting ring}in Shropshire, and most of the old{village pound}remains in existence. continued page 3
